page.title: 11THE VILLAGE HALL
page.content: This was built in 1822 by voluntary subscription.It was handed over to Durham County Council for a school.In 1964 a new school was built by the D.C.C. and the Hall was then altered and extended for use as a community centre.Today it is administered by an elected committee,made up of members of groups or individuals belonging to The Village Hall Association. The Hall is available for rent and is used weekly by the Youth Club and the Whist Drive Group.Monthly meetings are held by the Women's Institute and the Parish Council Meetings of both Hamsterley Parish and South Bedburn Parish.The local Playgroup meets twice weekly.The Village Hall Association runs its own functions too,such as dances,suppers and entertainments.It is also let to outside organisations to run functions or to camp in.
